titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. Martha Williams and Nancy E. Williams, Judgment
CWG8893

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwelth plantiff Breach of the peace
vs
Martha Williams Nancy. E. Williams

The case being called defendent claimed a Separate trial which was granted by the court and the case of martha Williams took up by agreement of parties it was tryed by 8 Jurors which after hearing the testimony of witness and argument of counsel Retired and Returned with the following verdict to wit. We of the Jury find the defendant martha Williams guilty as charged in the warrant and asses her fine to the commonwelth to twenty dollars and cost Isaac Raymer one of the Jury June the 20th 1863
B. J. Ray J. P E C
on motion of the attourney ^for^ the commonwelth the above case against N. E. Williams is dismissed with out prejudice June the 20th 1863
B. J. Ray J P E C
Martha Williams of Edmunson County Pettn to remit fine
No reliable ground shown for Exetv ruling.
